content.description: A tough crack climb that climbs out two roofs.
content.protection: gear
content.location: Starts on tree crack, to the right of Smokey Overhang's huge roof. goes left after the first roof.

content.description:
These routes were put/cleaned up during Covid and rioting approaching the 2020 election.  They do need more cleaning.

This route is on the left side of the segment of rock buttress to the left of the "Open Book" escarpment.

The route climbs an easy angle slab with good pro at the roof.  Move to the left and follow the left trending corner system.  Runner appropriately or you will pay the rope drag tax.

This is a good beginner trad route for placing gear and being safe while learning.

This does not have bolts at the top yet, but a shared set at the top of arete of fret could be very well placed.  I cleaned out some junk for gear, but you will need to set up a TR with trad gear, or will need to walk ~20 meters back to tie off on a tree.

I cleaned this route up as an option to take my kids who are learning to climb.  Good beginner route in general!
content.protection: single set of cams, nuts should suffice, though I found tricams useful as I do on many Minnehaha climbs!
content.location: This is to the left of the obvious "Open Book" face.  Walk through Oregon Grape to get to the base.

content.description: Bouldery traverse, then bouldery roof, then techno slab to the chains.
content.protection: Bolts
content.location: Just right of Smokey Overhang on a gently overhanging wall.  One of the few bolted routes (modern sport pitch) at Minne.

content.description: Skip the Peter Peckerman traverse and climb straight up the wall to the chains.  Essentially a V11 boulder problem to easier climbing above.
content.protection: Bolts
content.location: Just to the right of Smokey Overhang, on a gently overhanging wall.  Polinski soloed this route as well.

climbs.name: Open Face
climbs.fa: NA, long time ago I'm sure

content.description:
Start at the base of the face to the left of "Open Book".

This route has great positive ledges at the start that allow good, solid climbing with stances.

Follow the face climbing, with good crack protection, up to a stance.  Choose your poison and bail left for easy climbing, straight up the arete for moderate climbing, or out to the right for harder climbing.

This protects well with gear.

You can anchor off of the Open Book anchors, but it is sort of offset right for top roping.
content.protection: 1 set of nuts, 1 set of cams, tricams always place well at Minne!
content.location: This is to the left of Open Book.  Start is at the base of an obvious base.

content.description: Climb the dihedral, then make a couple cool moves over the roof.
content.protection: Standard rack to 2".
content.location: The far right side of the main wall. Look for the left-facing dihedral capped by a roof.

content.description: An easy route, at the roof head left to the chains.
content.protection:
Gear or Top Rope, bring long webbing.

When leading, a set of nuts and a few finger to mid sized cams work great.  Blue metolius works great on the left side of the overhang before pulling trough the roof.
content.location: On the north end of the main wall.

content.description: Follow the crack, it doesn't get much more simple than that.
content.protection: This route most often climbed on top rope.
content.location: On the main wall 2 or 3 routes from the south end of the rock.

content.description: Start on the left side of the boulder and traverse to the crack.
content.protection: No pad needed. It's a traverse with a good landing.
content.location: This line traverses the face of the house-sized boulder at the left end of the main wall.

content.description: To the left of the Smokey Overhang roof (main wall), there are two routes that ascend a bulge and join on the fun, easy slab above. This route is fully bolted for leading. Mad Dog is the route on the right. Positive holds make it easy for the grade and fun.

To the left of the Smokey Overhang roof (main wall), there are two routes that ascend a bulge and join on the fun, easy slab above. Bolts protect the crux but you'll have to find pro above. Love Bulge is the route on the left and is quite a bit more difficult than Mad Dog.
content.protection: mixed
content.location: Main Wall, to the left of the Smokey Overhang roof.

content.description: The crux is about 20 feet up.  Good hand holds.
content.protection:
Top anchors, nuts and quick draws.

This route starts from the top of the pedestal that is comfortably wide for a relaxed belay.  The easiest way to start this route is on the left of a large chunk of rock.  Climb up on good handholds with great parallel sided pods for finger sized cams until you hit the horizonal shelf.  Face climb past 2 bolts on thin edges as well as some patina holds.  Protection is all there for a solid lead, but it may not be a bad idea to TR this before you onsite.  Like much of Minnehaha, leading at the grade can get people in over their heads.
content.location: It is just left of main crack

content.description: Start standing on the boulder and pull over a roof in the nice hand and fist crack. If the start feels super hard keep fishing for holds. This crack is really good but really short.
content.protection: Gear to 3". Also takes large hexes well.
content.location: Far right side of the main wall. look for the straight-up fist crack that's close to Open Book.

content.description: The climb starts with two small crimps with a solid right heel hook. Move out left to a nice crimp. Stay low as you move to a match and then bump to either a pinch or a 3 finger crimp to the right (the Crux). Finally, grab the jug hold on the very top right and finish with a solid top out.
content.protection: none
content.location: This route is on the boulder just directly below the V8 Classic Smokey on fire. Pretty easy to find just walk the main wall path past The Dihedral and towards Smokey overhang.

content.description: This is a mixed route with a thin crux high up. It's delicate face climbing. The crux is pulling over a small roof onto a thin face. It's runout a bit through the crux, but the fall is safe.
content.protection: 2 bolts and a couple pieces of small gear.
content.location: The second bolted climb in on the far left of the main wall. It's right next to the house-sized boulder.

content.description: Although short, it's a fun, crimpy face climb. You could do it with 2 draws and a set of nuts.
content.protection: 2 bolts and a couple pieces of thin gear. Also an easy TR
content.location: The far left bolted route on the Main Wall. It's left of the house-sized boulder.

content.description: Arguably the  best route at Minne, Dihedral is often TR'd, but is an excellent lead. You'll lieback, jam, stem, crimp and smear up this one.  The Crux is at mid-height, after moving left from a good rest in the corner. sustained from this point. Many consider it hard for the grade.
content.protection: set of stoppers and cams to 2". 2 bolt anchor on top. bring webbing if you want to toprope.
content.location: Look for the obvious left facing corner in the middle of the main wall (facing Upriver Dr.) Easy walk off

content.description: Ascend the arete to the right of Dihedral. Powerful moves on the lower part, thin slab above with some delicate footwork on the arete. There are 4 bolts, and a couple possibilities for gear, but this climb rarely sees anything but a toprope. I think it's an under-rated climb- one of the best 10's at Minne! This climb is most fun if you keep your left hand on the arete all the way up, otherwise you end up on Ron's Climb.
content.protection: 4 bolts, some small pro.
content.location: Center of main wall, to the right of The Dihedral.

content.description: An easy start up an unprotected ramp starts feeling a bit spooky as you move onto the face. You could also do a direct start which is protectable with small gear.You'll start out using face holds to pull the roof, then the crack higher up.
content.protection: gear
content.location: Look for the left-leaning crack which is between the house-size boulder and Dihedral.

content.description:
This route is to the right of Open Book.  It can be TR'd off of bolts or lead with gear.  A single set of nuts and some small to medium cams protects this well when leading.

The climb is slabby with some ledges.  It follows a good crack that is protectable.  Good stances to place pro from make this a good beginning trad leaders route, but make sure to protect from falling on a ledge.
content.protection: Bolts at top, set of Metolius nuts 1-10 and Metolius cams 1-8 is more than enough to finish this climb and fully protect it.
content.location: To the right of Open book.  It starts at the base of a chimney but climbs the slab to the left.

content.description:
Bat Crack has a bouldery direct start that seems about 10b or c, and you won't get gear in until you're past the hard part.

To keep the 5.9 grade, traverse in fro the right on the big ledge.  Bring a 3" cam for the lead and be prepared for a somewhat difficult placement as you start up the crack. A big nut slots really well here.

The runout that gives Bat Crack a PG rating comes near the top as the crack disappears, but is no harder than 5.7.
content.protection: Tricky pro with a runout on easier moves.
content.location: The first crack to the right of Dihedral and Ron's Climb on the main face.

content.description:
A good beginner route to feel exposed on an arete.  This is left of the Open Book area.

Pass the roof on the left, then have fun stepping out onto the arete!  Good foot and handholds on the arete.  Follow the arete to the top.  Horizontals provide good, positive protection, but not a recommended first lead only due to trying to protect the first step out right onto the arete above the roof.

No bolts at the top.  Build your own anchor, or walk a long ways back to a tree.
content.protection:
Single set of cams and nuts should suffice, though I used tricams several times.

A set of bolts at the top of this route could serve all three routes in this area pretty well.
content.location: To the left of "Open Face" and "Open Book" escarpment.  Start under the roof.

content.description: This is a gear climb with 3 or 4 variations at the top, up to 5.10.
content.protection: gear
content.location: main wall. just right of house-size boulder

content.description:
This route starts in oregon grape looking up at the roof.

Jam and fist/hand crack move off the start.  Follow obvious corner to the top.  Several variations exist, depending on how you want to push out of the corner system.  Would recommend not going towards the arete and save that for a better, more continues arete climb by doing Arete of Fret.

A harder variation, Right Wing Extreme, at the top left exists, if you wish to push yourself a bit harder.

No bolts at the top; need a ~20m rope (or use your rope after leading), or build your own anchor.
content.protection: 1 set of nuts and cams should suffice; I found tricams useful and expedient.
content.location: Start below the roof and go to the right.  This is located to the left of Open Book and Open Face.

content.description: This is a great beginnner route, and a good route for a first trad lead as there are a lot of no-hands stances to use while you fiddle with gear. Y Crack shares anchors with the Heart Route, so you can set up a TR for the kiddos while you get some climbing in. Check out Hot Licks too(to the right), it's a great way to get a good burn in between belaying for your snot-nosed kids.
content.protection: Regular trad rack up to 3 inches. Traverse in from the west end of the Main Wall to set up a TR.
content.location: The obvious crack on the far left side of the main wall.

content.description: Not a great crack. dirty and flaring.
content.protection: gear
content.location: crack to the right of the huge Smokey Overhang roof.

content.description: Starts off the ledge route. a 2 bolt face climb. doesn't get done often.
content.protection: mixed
content.location: The bolted route that starts from the 5.0 ramp in the middle of the main wall.

content.description: A good crack climb with a hard roof start.
content.protection: gear to 3"
content.location: main wall, far right. It's the second crack over from the huge Smokey Overhang roof.

content.description: This worthy two-bolt variation of Dihedral skips the easier stuff up high by moving right onto the face and some tricky, thin moves. I've always wondered why you step right for Step Left...
content.protection: Standard rack up to 2" plus two quickdraws.
content.location: The obvious dihedral in the center of the main wall. Look for the bolts out right 2/3's up the route.

content.description: A bolted face climb to the right of Bat Crack. Shares the start with Bat Crack, which is kind of bouldery unless you traverse in from the right.
content.protection: mixed
content.location: main wall right side, first bolted route right of dihedral.

content.description: Start on the Smokey Overhang Crack or Rusty and follow the 3-bolt line over the roof.
content.protection: Standard rack to 2" plus 3 quickdraws.
content.location: Look for the bolted line to the left of the Smokey Overhang crack on the right side of the main wall.

content.description: Climb the crack in the big roof. It is rated anywhere from 5.9 to 5.10c.
content.protection: regular trad rack to 4"
content.location: Smokey Overhang ascends the obvious crack in the large roof on the right side of the main wall.

content.description: Starts low on the rail with heelhook near hands.  Then a powerful gaston move into the main rail.  There's a crimpy little feet off ending that may spit you off as well, but nothing as hard as the start.  If Kim Momb did this thing back in the late 80's as rumored, it was far beyond anything done around here at this time.
content.protection: na
content.location: Under the Smokey Overhang

content.description: A face climb with a big roof and a small crimp to pull you over. Crux at the obvious roof.
content.protection: mixed. use a medium cam under the roof. the crux is protected by a bolt. It looks like you're pretty well committed by the time you clip.
content.location: Main wall, center, just left of the Dihedral

content.description: Skirt the left side of the Smokey Overhang roof and move left to the bolt above the roof on Mad Dog.
content.protection: Regular trad rack to 2".
content.location: Look for the large roof on the right side of the main wall. Rusty is on the left side.

content.description: 3 bolts then a LONG runout to the top. Start with some long, athletic moves on the arete, then up on the face it's a very thin slab.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a few spots you could fiddle some gear in.
content.location: Starts on the arete to the right of Dihedral, Main Wall
